question: What is the name of the bot project designed by the researchers at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Ropar, to deliver medicines and food to COVID-19 patients in isolation wards?
explanation:
Researchers at the Punjab-based Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Ropar has designed a project called ‘WardBot’, which can deliver medicines and food to COVID-19 patients in isolation wards without engaging frontline health workers.
The WardBot works on the principle of ‘Smart line following’ and it can move on a pre-defined path using the sensors. Being operated from a control room, the bot efficiently delivers to different beds and automatically sanitises its path.
